summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Fifth Third Bank on September 26, 2019, demanding extensive financial records related to an ongoing criminal investigation into suspected violations including sex trafficking and conspiracy. The subpoena includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands Fifth Third Bank to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in New York to testify and produce requested financial records.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: The grand jury subpoena was issued and dated, formally requesting financial records from Fifth Third Bank as part of a federal criminal investigation.

locations: Fifth Third Bank, 5050 Kingsley Drive, Mail Drop 1MOC2Q, Cincinnati, OH 45263
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, New York, NY
26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278 (FBI office for record delivery)
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official federal grand jury investigation into suspected felony violations, specifically citing statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt/conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), 2422(b) (coercion/enticement for illegal sexual activity), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests the bank to voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

The subpoena demands a comprehensive set of financial records, including transaction files, signature cards, wire transfers, safe deposit records, loan applications, online banking IP logs, and all correspondence related to the accounts of specified individuals/entities.
The document indicates the investigation was active and ongoing as of September 2019, targeting financial records to trace activities related to the alleged criminal violations.
